Detailed Description

Interface for observable entities in a simulation.

Member Function Documentation

◆ expose_for_getting()

virtual void cse::observable::expose_for_getting ( variable_type  ,
value_reference   
)
pure virtual

Exposes a variable for retrieval with get_xxx().

The purpose is fundamentally to select which variables get transferred from remote simulators at each step, so that each individual get_xxx() function call doesn't trigger a separate RPC operation.

◆ get_boolean()

virtual bool cse::observable::get_boolean ( value_reference  ) const
pure virtual

Returns the value of a boolean variable.

The variable must previously have been exposed with expose_for_getting().

◆ get_integer()

virtual int cse::observable::get_integer ( value_reference  ) const
pure virtual

Returns the value of an integer variable.

The variable must previously have been exposed with expose_for_getting().

◆ get_real()

virtual double cse::observable::get_real ( value_reference  ) const
pure virtual

Returns the value of a real variable.

The variable must previously have been exposed with expose_for_getting().

◆ get_string()

virtual std::string_view cse::observable::get_string ( value_reference  ) const
pure virtual

Returns the value of a string variable.

The variable must previously have been exposed with expose_for_getting().

The returned std::string_view is only guaranteed to remain valid until the next call of this or any other of the object's methods.
